comment.author: 34586311@N05
comment._content: Check the note on this picture, which points out the bell tower on the First Congregational United Church at the corner of Park and Madison in Portland. According to the church web site, the First Congregational United Church of Christ was established in 1851 and designed by Swiss architect Henry J. Hefty to resemble Old South Church in Boston. The 175-foot bell tower added in 1891. The stained glass windows were designed by Povey Brothers of Portland. Thanks to ~MVI~ (mining in the archives) for this beautiful photo of the tower! [http://www.flickr.com/photos/bigberto/2869072935/]
